goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata
measurement_units: Percentage, Million cubic meters per year
goal_name: 6. Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
target_name: 6.4 By 2030, substantially increase water-use efficiency across all sectors and ensure sustainable withdrawals and supply of freshwater to address water scarcity and substantially reduce the number of people suffering from water scarcity
organization_name: Department of Digital Development and Sustainable Development Statistics
definitions: The indicator determines the volume of fresh water that is lost during transportation between the point of its intake and the point of use and is expressed as the total volume of lost water and as a percentage of losses from the total gross volume of water withdrawn by the water supply industry.
concepts: Water losses during transportation to places of use are an indicator of the irrational use of limited natural resources, as well as the inefficiency of the water management system, including technical conditions affecting water supply systems, water prices and public awareness.
rationale_interpretation: This indicator is of great importance for the targeted provision of efficient water use and allows us to determine the effectiveness of response measures aimed at improving water management systems.
data_sources: Form No. 2 TP Vodkhoz "Report on general indicators of water use"
data_collection: The indicator is formed annually by the DVHM under the Ministry of Agriculture and Food of the Kyrgyz Republic, since 2019 by the GAVR under the RCC, and then presented to the NSC of the Kyrgyz Republic as "water losses during transportation," where respondents are public or private organizations whose main functions are collecting, purifying and distributing water for domestic, industrial and other purposes.
computation_methods: The indicator is expressed as the total volume of lost water in million m3, as well as as a percentage of losses from the total gross volume of water withdrawn by the water supply industry.
comments_limitations: This indicator makes it possible to determine the effectiveness of measures aimed at improving the water management system in a particular country.
data_availability_gaps: The indicator is calculated on the basis of GAVR data under the RCC, which, in turn, are presented by economic entities that collect, purify and distribute
disaggregation: the Republic's water in the context of regions.
international_comparability: The UNSD/UNEP questionnaire on environmental statistics. Joint OECD Questionnaire/Eurostat 2012: Inland Waters (Table 3). International Recommendations on Water Resources Statistics (IWRM), UN 2012.
references_documentation: The National SDG Reporting Platform of the Kyrgyz Republic: https://sustainabledevelopment-kyrgyzstan .github.io
